Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Cheaply \Cheap"ly\, adv. At a small price; at a low value; in a common or inferior manner. [1913 Webster]

cheaply adv 1: in a stingy manner; "their rich uncle treated them rather chintzily" [syn: {stingily}, {chintzily}] 2: in a cheap manner; "a cheaply dressed woman approached him in the bar" [syn: {tattily}, {inexpensively}] [ant: {expensively}] 3: with little expenditure of money; "I bought this car very cheaply" [syn: {inexpensively}]
